TaxonIdentification.species_authority: (Howell ex A. Gray) B. L. Robinson

place_of_publication.publication_title: in C. L. Hitchcock et al., Vasc. Pl. Pacif. N.W.

treatment.description: Basal leaf blades ± linear, mostly 2–3 cm. Cauline leaves usually absent. Inflorescences: basalmost bract margins glandular-toothed. Petals pale pink to deep purple-magenta or rose, (10–)12–13 mm. 2n = 30.
treatment.discussion: B. Mathew (1989b) noted that the cultivated Lewisia columbiana ‘Rosea’ is this variety. B. L. Davidson (2000) noted that the United States populations have pink to magenta petals, whereas the British Columbia populations have white to pale pink petals characteristic of the other varieties. Mathew questioned the assignment of the British Columbia plants to this variety.
